thread.title: Northbridge 42, Tantasqua 7: Shutout streak ends, but Mike Quinn records two safeties for No. 2 Rams
thread.title_full: Northbridge 42, Tantasqua 7: Shutout streak ends, but Mike Quinn records two safeties for No. 2 Rams

author: Bill Ballou
title: Northbridge 42, Tantasqua 7: Shutout streak ends, but Mike Quinn records two safeties for No. 2 Rams
text: Northbridge 42, Tantasqua 7: Shutout streak ends, but Mike Quinn records two safeties for No. 2 Rams Posted Oct. 23, 2015 at 11:03 pm Updated at 11:20 PM STURBRIDGE — There are numbers in safeties. Mike Quinn made a pair of tackles in the end zone here on Friday night as part of second-ranked Northbridge High’s 42-7 victory over Tantasqua, and while the Rams’ 35-point margin of victory wound up being a comfortable one, Quinn’s first safety seemed to mark a turning point in what was a close game for the first half. It came with just 28 seconds left in the second period and turned a 14-7 Northbridge lead into a two-score advantage at 16-7. “That safety really seemed to take the wind out of (Tantasqua’s) sails,” Rams coach Ken LaChapelle said. The second safety came with the game well in hand and punctuated a diverse night of point accumulation for Northbridge, which scored almost every way possible. It had the two safeties by Quinn, five PAT kicks by Geoffrey Reichert and a 36-yard field goal by Reichert, and by the way, four rushing touchdowns by Jake Wood, three in the third quarter. The Rams remained unbeaten with the victory, extending their winning streak to seven games. The Warriors fell to 5-2 and have lost two of their last three. One consolation for Tantasqua was that it snapped Northbridge’s six-game shutout streak by scoring the first opposition points of the season versus the Rams defense. They came on a big play that at the time seemed like it could be a momentum-creator. Northbridge jumped ahead, 7-0, when Koby Schofer hit Chandler Brooks for 5 yards and a touchdown —and Reichert converted — at 5:16 of the first period. Just 27 seconds later, Tantasqua quarterback Jordan Choquette connected on his 16th touchdown pass of the season, with his favorite target, J.J. Howland. The play covered 68 yards as Howland caught a strike over the middle, cut down the left sideline and outran the Rams' secondary. That made it a 7-7 game, then Wood scored on a 1-yard run late in the quarter, and Quinn came up with the key safety at the end of the half. “We took it to heart a little bit,” Wood said of the Warriors’ score, “but it’s the bigger picture we were looking at after that, winning a football game, not keeping a team scoreless every week. The reality is, that’s not gonna happen." Wood scored on runs of 1, 40, 5 and 36 yards as Northbridge employed its ground game more than usual. “We did what we had at the beginning, but after that safety — do we dare say we got a little conservative when you run the ball three plays and you’re in?" LaChapelle said. “Then our defense just got hungrier and hungrier.” LaChapelle and Northbridge defensive coordinator Steve Falconer agreed that the shutout streak would end sooner or later. “It was hard to believe that in six games, somebody wouldn’t have scored just by accident,” LaChapelle said. “I feel like, a little bit in a way, that we might have been focusing on it too much,” Falconer said, “and we might have been robbing some of the younger kids of playing time towards the end because we had made it such a focus. “It’s not realistic to go to the end of the season without allowing a point, and I’ll trade those two safeties for the seven points any time.” The safeties were Northbridge’s second and third of the season, a school record, and Quinn is the first Rams defender with two in a year, let alone a game. —Contact Bill Ballou at wballou@telegram.com. Follow him on Twitter @BillBallouTG. Please send resume to: smartllc@smartconstructioncorp.com [+] COORDINATOR, EMERGENCY STABILIZATION PROGRAM The COORDINATOR, EMERGENCY STABILIZATION PROGRAM The Emergency Stabilization/Homeless Prevention Program of Catholic Charities Worcester County is accepting resumes for tyhe position of Coordinator, Emergency Stabilization Program. This position oversees the provision of services to clients who are at risk of homelessness and hunger and in need of basic assistance. The position provides direct services to clients, case management and staff supervision. Hours are 37.5/week, Monday-Friday. A bachelor's degree in Human Service or a related field, with at least one year of supervisory experience is preferred. Interested candidates should send a resume and cover letter to: HRM, 10 Hammond St, Worcester, MA 01610 AA/EOE [+] CASE MANAGER POSITIONS - FULL TIME Montachusett CASE MANAGER POSITIONS - FULL TIME Montachusett Home Care Corp., a growing full social service agency serving elderly and the disabled has openings for full-time Case Managers in its State Home Care programs: A Bachelor's degree in Human Services or related field is required plus one year experience in casework. Eligibility for social work licensure is preferred. MHCC offers a friendly work environment, flexible work schedules, generous vacation, sick & holidays. Benefits include health, disability & life insurance, 403B matching, flexible spending etc. Older workers, minorities, and Spanish speaking individuals are encouraged to apply. A driver's license along with a fully registered and insured automobile is required. Computer experience is necessary. Send resume to: Montachusett Home Care Corporation Human Resources Department 680 Mechanic St., Leominster, MA 01453 Or via e-mail: mhcc@mhcc-1.org AA/EOE [+] RESIDENTIAL STAFF/HUMAN SERVICES Youville House RESIDENTIAL STAFF/HUMAN SERVICES Youville House Shelter for Families, a program of Catholics Charities Worcester county, is accepting resumes for Residential Staff, to work a variety of shifts. Experience working with homelessness or in a Human Service environment is preferred. Interested candidates should send a resume and cover letter to HRM, 10 Hammond St, Worcester, MA 01601. AA/EOE [+] NURSING POSITIONS - PART-TIME Montachusett Home NURSING POSITIONS - PART-TIME Montachusett Home Care Corporation, a social service agency serving both disabled and elderly population has openings for part-time RN positions in the Personal Care Attendant Program. Experience working with disabled consumers in the community is preferred. Position involves completing in-home assessments of need and confirming program eligibility. RN candidates should have at least 2 years experience in community nursing or 1-2 years of inpatient experience with the disabled population. Massachusetts RN and Motor Vehicle licenses are required. A fully registered and insured automobile is a must. Working knowledge of computers is necessary. Part time hours will be either 2 full work days or 2.5 work days each week. Enjoy nights, weekends, and holidays with your family. Older workers, minorities, and Spanish speaking individuals are encouraged to apply. Send resume by October 16, 2015 to: Montachusett Home Care Corporation Crossroads Office Park 680 Mechanic St., Leominster, MA 01453 Or via e-mail: mhcc@mhcc-1.org AA/EOE [+] HOME
